(Anyone who is a regular, feel free to connect with me. I just moved to Phoenix from Boston and I'm looking for other expats...or those who are East Coast at heart)

I love Casablanca, every time I'm in town i make sure to stop by and enjoy a delicious cocktail. This place is a staple in my Scottsdale itinerary. I highly recommend you grab some friends and start your night here.

My friends and I stopped in here last night around 9 for drinks and music.  What a great setting, we loved the vibe.  We are in our late 30's (ugh can't believe I just said that) just looking to chill, not party.  The vibe here is perfect for that, exactly what we were expecting/wanting.  The rooftop section is gorgeous, we sat out there a bit then moved inside when the band started up.  We got a seat immediately but the longer we sat the busier it got.  I'll remember to get there early, especially if we have a group.  The drinks are pricey, to be expected for a venue such as this, but the pours are too small.  My husband's first old fashioned was literally 2 swallows, with his second old fashioned being about 3 times as large.  Not sure if they made a mistake?  I don't like inconsistency.  Also, I was expecting a lounge with such a great 'theme' to have some amazing craft cocktails but the list was unimpressive at best.  A little disappointing.   That being said, the band was phenomenal and fit the atmosphere of this old school lounge.  We will be regulars whenever we get the chance to go out and about later at night without our kids in tow! Thanks Casablanca for providing a more classy establishment compared with the majority of loud bars/clubs in downtown Scottsdale.  Not everyone likes to get sloppy drunk and party!

I'm very discouraged. . I've called 3 times and left vmails trying to make a reservation.  No one returns calls. I've sent an email... no one replies. I've been the before and liked the venue but it's not that serious to have to chase them down to reserve and spend my money.  I may just look elsewhere.  So disappointed.
Fun location and the layout makes for an eventful night...Bathrooms were pretty clean so that is a big plus for a night club
Classy, fun, and comfortable. Friday night live band playing R&B and Hip Hop hits always delivers great entertainment.

Stopped here for a couple drinks around 5 pm on a Saturday night.  Looks like more of a club than an evening hangout. There were only about 10 other people there.  DJ was playing 80's/early 90's R&B, so if that's your style, roll in here.  Small selection of apps, but we just came for drinks.  Great patio.  Friendly staff.  A decent place to grab a drink if you're in Old Town.

Went on a Saturday night and there was live music! Unfortunately, not the best live music. The drinks were fantastic and the service was good all but the doorman. The outside waitress was extremely helpful and accommodating with seating. The ambiance was so beautiful but I wish the music was better. If you bring in an amazing singer and band it would make a difference.  I would suggest LadeeJ or Rosco for live entertainment and it will change the game.
I really enjoyed my time there. Live Music and environment was excellent. They also have a. Wet good food menu.

Stacey our server was Top Notch. The food was awesome. I recommend the cheese board and the chicken wings and the rose a champagne worth $100 bottle when I come back Scottsdale I'm definitely going back to Casablanca

Absolutely terrible!!!  Subtract stars!!!!  Patio singer was great and we decided to check it out.  We became a party of 7, continuously ordering drinks for 3 hours...Only to have an employee come by our section and put a sign on the table indicating it "Reserved", while we're there.  She then came by a few minutes later and told us we had to get up from our section and stand somewhere else unless we ordered a bottle!!  They wanted the section free in case anyone showed up and was willing to order a bottle-otherwise, it would sit empty.  What kind of "business" does that to paying customers??!!  We live within walking distance and frequent a number of the places there.  Will NEVER go back there...EVER!!!!  And I let everyone I know and meet what occurred.  Go to KAZIMER across the street.  Awesome live bands and they don't KICK you out of your seats!!!

If, I could give it a negative star I would. We made a 7 dinner reservation and then were called to say it was 7:30. then a text saying it had been changed to 8pm. Once we got there they 'apologized' but they don't serve food anymore. No accommodations for maybe some drinks to make up for the inconvenience. They indicated that they had to let their chef go and did not give a courtesy call to let us know. We had friends came out  for a special event and they traveled from tempe which made me look like so improper. So inconvenient. When I called to talk to the Manager she was very sarcastic to me and said to me " I can keep my reservation and I will go in the  kitchen and make  your food for you " So rude!! Stay clear of this place!   ***In response to your email Samantha whom made the booking my friend she has email confirmation and text messages to prove that reservations made and she spoke with Ashley to make the reservation, there was no communication, there was a lack of care for the customer and owning up the mistake while we were present. Samantha stated she will be in touch with the manager.***

Finally a place in AZ, I can actually dance in without feeling like the odd ball. Decent size dance floor with a stage (only for after the live entertainment is finish) two outdoor patios, one side has heaters the other side has a fire pit. There are two DJ's at this spot one inside and out (got to love that) keep the party going.  The restrooms are clean and have no waiting lines. Tons of room for sitting and VIP areas. The Strawberry Martini that the bartender made me had fresh crushed strawberries and was on point. Must I add the shots here ALL top shelf tequila may just do the trick, by only the first two hits LOL.  I gave Casablanca four stars because the DJ inside wasn't really paying attention to the crowd body language is key. Too many slow jams people were complaining and waiting for a faster beat. Faster songs more shots and drinks were flying just an FYI.  Now that that's all out; will I return a little visit? Yes, why not!!! I may have to bring a bit more friends this time grab a bigger table and dance my boot'a off.

I gave this place a 2nd shot a few months after our 1st experience.  Service was terrible both times.  No music.  the movie outside was distracting because it was complete silence and this bright movie.    Cocktails are VERY over priced especially for the amature "mixologists".  I will not go back or suggest this place.  I am shocked they are still in business.  Sad because it could be very cool.

They way over charge for drinks! We had vodka and redbulls, they charged $12 for the vodka (1 shot kettle one) and $4 for the redbull. So basically $16 each drink. Not to mention the drinks were very small and mostly ice. They charged us for 8 drinks when we only ordered 6. Horrible service! The dance floor is tiny but music is good. Don't waste you money on this place.

I'm giving this place two stars; one for having good food and drinks and one for having a great atmosphere.  However I did not feel like I had a good experience here last night.  A Group of friends and I sat on the patio last night. The gentleman in our group was about 150 pounds and he sat in one of the patio chairs.  Within the first 10 minutes of arriving one of the legs on the chair broke and my friend fell flat on his back on the patio. The manager or supervisor never came over to make sure he was OK and not injured. Later in the night a server brought over an extra martini that we did not order. We triple check to make sure that everyone had a drink before she set it down and we said we did not order that, everyone has their drink nobody is done with their drink yet. She left it on the table and said "I'm sure someone will drink this if I leave it here" and still charged us for that drink that nobody drank. Finally when it came time to go I was in a little bit of a rush to get home when I realize the server hadn't come back to our table for half an hour.  It took us half an hour to get our check, we had to stand up and get her attention to come over and bring us the check. This place is beautiful with a great atmosphere and great food and drinks and has such potential to be five stars. Unfortunately, The experience we had was terrible.

My friend and I just went in, asked for cocktail menus, and then sat for 20 minutes trying to get the bartenders attention to take our orde.r, while he immediately took the orders of groups of men who .walked up to the bar. It wasn't even crowded and it was completely futile to get a drink in there. Needless to say we walked out drinkless.
Really cool joint. Very nice view from the deck, excellent music, good drinks. The food is a little different but really good. A great way to spend an evening out!

I love this place, its great for hanging with friends over some very fabulous cocktails or just chill'n with your fave. The rooftop patio is really awesome but with the warmer weather I love the inside too!

Never book a party here!!!   I have to first say that the waitstaff and bartender who worked our party were great, but the party planner is an idiot!  Our party was suppose to be from 7 to 10 on the patio.  We were told that they opened at 6 so we showed up at 6:30 set up for our party only to find that they had booked another party on the patio the same day from 3 to 7. (This is kind of funny since we asked to use the inside party room and were told we couldn't because there was a party there starting at 10.)   We had no time to set up before the birthday girl arrived and had to fight to get the DJ from the previous party to leave so that would could finally set up. Also they were suppose to "rope off" part of the patio for our party, but they had nothing (not even a sign) to indicate that it was a private party so we had people eating our food and sitting with our party (can't really blame them since they had no idea it was a private party).  The food was mediocre and they had no lighting on the food tables so you couldn't even see what there was which I think lead to most of the food going to waste.   Luckily, like I said the waitstaff and bartender were great, so we manage to have a good time despite the stressful way the night started.

I was looking for live music and stumbled across this gem of Old Town! Aside from an amazing band (Ear Candy) the view from the rooftop patio was stunning. They had a small appetizer style menu... Lobster Grilled Cheese? ! Yes please! I had the Lavender Mule to drink & was thoroughly impressed... Edible orchid infused ice cubes?! Yep! Though I don't get out often, I highly recommend Casablanca and will be back the next time I have a babysitter!
No live music on Sat! Very very dark . Very loud .... not a fan. Artist outside painting ... was cool. Smoky.

The band and music is always great. There is always a crowd. I invite all R&B lovers to come out on Saturday nights. It is free and always a good time. Plenty of comfortable lounge chairs for a nice evening enjoying good R&B music both from the live band until midnight and then an awesome DJ takes over. They also have a cigar bar area on the balcony outside. The menu items are perfect for the evening.

This place is great! My group of friends and I enjoyed the outdoor atmosphere. The manager Viet was very nice and set us up in a really cool seating area.  We'll be back to visit this place the next time we're in town.

Love, love, love the music outside in the patio. The one thing that pissed me off was the bartender charged my friend and I $6 for beers. I went back an hour later and ordered the same beer from the same bartender and he charged me $5 for the same beer. Wtf??!!

Casablanca Lounge is such a fun hidden gem in Scottsdale, Arizona.   Here is why it's awesome: -Beautiful, classy interior: dim lighting, high back booths for privacy -Service is always kind, courteous, respectful and attentive -Music has never let me down (depends on what you like)  -Theme nights: 2 weekends ago I went for Reggae night and it was so much fun!  -Outside roof lounge area, with plenty of comfortable Canopy seating and a great view of the city. -Music easily can be enjoyed outside too -Cigar roller if you're feeling extra fancy   Drinks are fancy, so they are a bit pricier- but that is to be expected given the alcohol brands. Drinks are delicious here!   Always have a great time. Careful taking the stairs back down if you're tipsy!

without a doubt the worst service I have ever received ... last night, Thursday Oct 24th, we arrived at the lounge which is absolutely beautiful ... a band was playing and they were wonderful ... we were three of maybe 20 customers in the entire place and we took seats at the bar. it took a good 8 to 10 minutes for the bartender to get to us although we were trying to get her attention ... she appeared to be a new bartender as she was searching for bottles and did not seem to know the location of things behind the bar. we enjoyed our cocktails and listened to the band, after about 25 or 30 minutes I was ready for another cocktail, try as I may I could not get the bartenders attention, mind you, at this point there were maybe only 10 customers in the entire bar including the patio area ... I finally got the attention of the manager who came behind the bar and he got me a second cocktail.  during the time that he was getting my cocktail the band took a break between sets, when the band was ready to start the final set, it took about 7 or 8 minutes for them over the microphone to get the attention of the manager and bartender to turn off the house music ... at this point there are only 5 people in the bar who were all laughing because it was so funny that the band could not get the attention of the employees, the manager finally turned off the house music and the band began playing the final set, at this point my two friends were ready for their second cocktail and we again could not get the attention of the bartender or the manager ... we were literally waving our arms for a good 5 minutes trying to get their attention, I finally got up from my seat and walked to the end of the bar where the manager was socializing with the bartender and I asked him if I could speak to him for a moment to which she said sure and stepped from behind the bar to talk to me and I explained to him that although the bar was beautiful and the band was very engaging and wonderful that the service was absolutely horrible ... his response was, and I quote " well then I think you've had enough and you guys should leave", absolutely no apology for the poor service, just told us to leave, mind you, my friends were still waiting for just thier secnd drink and I was still enjoy my second. I absolutely will not be back and I will be contacting the general manager to discuss the situation.  On a side note, The manager on duty seemed to be flirting and making himself very familiar with the bartender. I did pay my $30 tab and tipped the bartender $5 ... even though the service was very slow, she was friendly and again it was obvious that she was new.  The managers attitude on the other hand was horrific and completely unacceptable.

Loved the live music (Thursday night) as well as the ambience.  Had an old Audrey Hepburn movie playing in the background (Breakfast at Tiffany's, I think?) outside on the deck.  Great place to have it and a nice set up.  Wasn't overly crowded either.  Considering there weren't that many people, service was a bit slow.  Drinks are also on the pricier side too.  But I'd come back, esp. if there's live music.

to the extent that this site is for rating places according to their food, please ignore this post.  We did not eat here, just came in to hear the "live" music.  Caveat for those of you who think that "live" music connotes human being(s) playing some kind of instrument (s), usually with vocal accompaniment.  A guy with all kinds of fancy electronics and lighting, thumping out mixes of dance-inducing R&B, as talented as the guy was here, is not "live" music and should not be advertised as such, IMHO.  That said, the Saturday night crowd was having a great time, and the patio seemed like a very nice setting for dining out above the fray.

I love playing here. There's always a nice mix of people. Never heard about anybody getting shot here or and fights breaking out here. Now I've seen some drunk people fall. I've met some great people. Also met some celebrities I thought I'd never meet. And as a drummer it really is one of the best places in old town to play at. Because I always keep it 1000 my only gripe as a musician is the route to germ drums up to the 3rd floor sucks but it's totally worth it. No matter what time you come here it will most definitely be a good experience. Beautiful classy staff as well what more can ya ask for.

I went here for my 21st birthday last night and I do not think I could have had a better time. It started when my friends and I arrived and was greeted by Taylor the Hostess who was so welcoming and friendly. Trisha the event coordinator was absolutely amazing and so accommodating to my every wish. We sat outside on the patio by the fire pit, and it was probably the best seat in the house It was so comfortable for my 15-20 person party. Ashley was our server and she was the best. She had great recommendations and knew EXACTLY what she was talking about when it came to explaining all the different drinks. Rich the Bar Manager was just as wonderful and even created a special drink for my birthday so my friends and I could enjoy something personalized just for me. Prices were totally fair, music was great to dance to outside, and the view from the patio was to die for. I am so so happy I came here for my birthday, and will continue to come here. Again thank you so much everyone. :)

I always have a good time when I come here. I don't go to people watch or even really to drink, I come for the dj on the patio. He kills it everytime, and I am so obsessed with him. He plays all of the music I grew up listening to..east coast hip hop, reggae, to name a few. I don't know his name, but I tell everyone about his skills, and people that frequent the spot, all agree....he is on point!! I will be making a trip there soon so I can!

When it comes to hospitality, Rikee at Casablanca takes care of it all. Whether you want to book a corporate event, a nice date with special attention to detail, or a fun night out with friends, Casablanca has all the ingredients and potential for a memorable time! I am really looking forward to returning to the area during Spring Training to soak in some baseball, sunshine, cervezas, and margaritas!
Casa Blanca has a beautiful view of the city. Romantic with fire pits. Nice background music. Staff very nice. Good for a romantic evening or to gather with friends.
Definitely the best spot to start your night! Awesome atmosphere and amazing hospitality.

Needed a night out with the girls. Wanted something relaxed, classy. Good spot, No cover, reasonable drinks. They don't serve food anymore on Friday nights, but we were able to get a cheese plate out of the kitchen : )  Crowd appeared 30's and Up. Music was a mixture....

This was the last of 5 stops on our Valentine's celebration adventure. What can I say, my man knows I have to see the town. After Kazimierz we were elated to actually have a cushy place to sit, with service! The entertainment and crowd were more of the mid 40s-50s variety but we had a good time. And I appreciated a little ethnic diversity here in Scottsdale (a bit more like I was back home in L.A.). I got up to join in on the Cupid Shuffle at one point, and my watermelon cocktail (while heavy on the jalapeno) was refreshing.

I attended a private party in the speakeasy.  It was quite a fantastic set up!  Super cozy and intimate with a decent sized patio and pool table.  Television, couches, chairs.  It was really great.  The ordering was a bit confusing, there was an ipad involved but it was just easier to ask to server for what we wanted.

We walked in on a Thursday evening and waited 10 minutes to be seated, some one walked up to us and in a matter of fact way said "sit any where" and also said it's a slow night we only have 2 wait staff. We then waited another 15 minutes and one of the staff brought ONE glass of water for two of us. About 5 minutes later another glass of water and the drinks menu. 20 minutes later and no one came by to take our order, then a few minutes later we were told they were not serving dinner on Thursday's (this was at 7.30PM) he also said I'll buy you a free drink cause you waited so long - we left! He can take the free drink and ... I understand the challenges but the cheap unprofessional attitude surprises me. Won't return!

I just love the patio here.  And actually there are two patios.  One faces more the city of Scottsdale, but the real gem is the one on canal with the tall buildings in the background.  I would love to come here to see the sunset.  Also, the band we saw was very good but not really my cup of tea.  I would like to try again with a more jazz or blues band.  The drinks are really good too.  I had a Moscow Mule but they have some other mixed drinks too.  We also had a chochloate lava cake that was really delicious.  I'll be back for sure.

Update review::: Casablanca lounge invited me back and it was wonderful they treated me so well they comped what I had paid for on NYE and it was great the treatment I received was so wonderful thank you to Ashlyn and Kristina and the staff and also thank you to Cody for handling everything so professionally.. I really appreciate it. You GUYS ROCK!!!

This place has a good atmosphere, with great music and drinks. However, the ladies restroom was poorly maintained and needs some repairs. I was also disappointed that I paid for tickets through their website for the Labor Day Weekend event, and when we showed up there was no line, no cover and the place wasn't busy at all.

Horrible place! Mangers and bartenders are very rude! I'm a bartender and I will never treat ppl the way they do. They hate friday nights with African Americans.. They all act like we don't tip!! It's sad.. We're all not the same. But they see why all the other clubs in the area out beat them every weekend.. Because they don't know how to treat ppl!

The decor of this place is really neat. It's dim and intimate inside (in fact, it's so dim they have to give you a menu that lights up!) and they have some really comfy chairs to sit on. The DJ who was working on Saturday night was playing some fun music, but the volume was a little too loud for a "lounge."  I could only talk to the people sitting immediately next to me, and even then I had to yell a little.  The patio was a nice escape from the loud music.  They had a lot of seating out there and a nice view of the courtyard to people watch.

Interesting spot that I have been to a few different times. The service can be good some nights and poor other nights. They have a decent selection of cocktails whiskeys and other drinks. Has live music most of the time. Best part of the place is the Outdoor patios. Up on the 2nd and 3rd floor you can Overlook Old Town Scottsdale.

Wow Worst service ever We came in and sat down and no waitress ever came by to visit us When we finally asked for a waitress she came over and asked us what do you want  Our response was menus would be nice No refills of  water we were just pretty much ignored the rest of the night We put a credit card down to hold open a tab Then tried to pay cash and that confused the waitresses even further As I write this review we are  still waiting for the cash and the credit card and a manager it's been 15 minutes

This is a great, comfortable place to hangout, meet friends, dance and enjoy good appetizers and great drinks. They always have a friendly crowd you can have cigars on the outdoor patio that is very large with a nice fireplace, heaters and a great view of downtown Scottsdale. The live band is terrific, they play a great combo of contemporary pop, Motown, and disco. Service is great the services are attentive and friendly. Great place to stop in after dinner.

Went on a Wednesday night, must have been after a happy hour crush as the outdoor patio was mostly empty but the place was trashed with un bused tables with leftovers and empty glasses.  Gross.  BTW the inside area had no seating up other than the three booths across from the bar.  If you didn't know there was an outside rooftop seating area, you would think the place had closed down.  They need to make the bar MUCH more presentable when you enter the front door.

Wow, lots of interesting and covert language about urban music and attracting the "wrong crowd" in Richard's reply to my review. Also note the frown upon "booty shaking" as if that's not a fairly universal pastime amongst all age and race demographics. Other cultures may call it "boot scooting" or "shaking a tailfeather", but the concept is the same Richard.   I get your point though, you don't want people moving rhythmically at Casablanca. You want them to be sedate. Got it!  I'd encourage Richard to maybe visit SumoMaya and other upscale establishments in Scottsdale that cater to the "lounge" crowd Casablanca aspires to attract. They play current pop music (the kind that's on the radio and pop charts!!) and some rap (!!) and still manage to attract a classy, mature, sophisticated crowd. It's regretful Casablanca couldn't pull this off, but IMO wrong to blame a genre of music for their failure to attract the "right crowd" to their establishment.   Also just who is "the wrong crowd", Richard? We who frequented Casablanca Lounge when the music was better are all childless professionals with disposable income who've traveled extensively. I have a career in Wealth Management. My girlfriends who I frequented this establishment with are Vice Presidents of Strategy, Directors of Operations, Business Analysts, District Managers, etc.. So, professional women who like to dance (and yes BOOTY SHAKE!) on the weekend are amongst the wrong crowd Richard would prefer not to have at Casablanca Lounge? Interesting and GREAT to know!!  Lastly, maybe they should update their menu to highlight these many cocktails that cost less than $12 or $14 instead of leaving patrons the responsibilty to "guess" drinks that may be better priced, but are nowhere to be found on the menu?

Casablanca. With a name like that you expect great things. What comes to mind for me is the movie, which could very easily go down as one of the top ten films of all time. Casablanca might go down as one of my top ten worst dining/going out experiences of all time, so I guess there is SOME similarity? That's stretching it...  I am going to relate my experience here to the early stages of dating. You meet the guy and the first impression is fantastic. You even think "Oh my gosh, maybe he's THE ONE!" and you can't wait to spend time with them. Maybe you meet for drinks for the first date, the guy was late, but you have delish drinks and great convo. You can't wait for a second date. Second date, you go to dinner. the food takes almost an hour to come out and is awful but you don't want to be a debbie downer and say anything. You pick at it in awkward silence as suddenly the glamour of what could have been has worn off and you realize you don't have much to say to this guy. But hey, maybe it was an "off" night. Then the guy pulls the whole "I forgot my wallet" act and you are stuck with the bill for something you didn't even enjoy in the first place. On top of that, there are items on the bill you didn't even order, but you just want to get the heck out of there so you pay. There are lots of apologies, he still tries to kiss you, and you leave irritated and pissed off wishing you had those two hours back, BUT that musician at the restaurant was super hot. Hmmm, wonder if he is single?   Casablanca looks great and sends out a great vibe. I was initially excited we were kicking off the evening there. Then to discover they weren't ready for our group (and they had weeks of notice) and made us stand around while they pushed tables together, etc. AWKWARD. The light up menus and drinks were fun and began to turn things around for me. I LOVED their seasonal drink and the Sophia bubbly. Then the food came (literally after an hour of us ordering it, I don't think most realized this otherwise we all probably would have been disgruntled a lot sooner) The food is a JOKE. The cheese and meat plate, all I could think was "WTF?" It was pathetic. We all had the thought about Postino being way better. But to be honest, I can't even help you understand how bad it was. The fact that a classy Scottsdale joint would serve that to their patrons (with a $25 price tag) and think people will be okay with it blows my mind. Tiny pieces of cheese. Pre packaged, presliced salami. Crackers I can find at Safeway. The hummus, also pathetic. It should be called the tzatziki plate. And we were given maybe three pieces of actual pita and told they were going to charge us for more. WOW. The blue cheese olives were the only thing I found yum, unique and not disappointing.   Now we get to the fun part. The god awful service. Some girls got there late so I decided to hunt down our server so they could order a drink before we left. I was wandering for five minutes (and the place is not very big) before someone FINALLY asked if I needed help. I don't blame our server for this at all. This is management and the event coordinator's fault. (Oh, and the event coordinator, I'd like to know what exactly her job is. She greeted us, said she'd be back to get us a round of drinks and was never to be found again. It wasn't that busy nor did it look like there were any other large groups there) The manager finally came out as if to our rescue and made things worse. I would rather have dealt with the newbie server and walked her through it patiently. Instead it took us 30 minutes to sort out the bill, which was separated into eight difference checks (when we had asked that three of us get put on one to "make it easy", we were charged for items we didn't order, and even when they "fixed" it there were errors but we just rolled with it because we so desparately wanted to leave.   Luckily we went to Mabel's after which was a 5 star experience so the night was quickly redeemed and we had a BLAST.   The ONLY reason this place gets two stars instead of one: The entertainment was AMAZING and the place has potential to be better. I really hope they get their act together.
